00115 
00116 void testPeak()
00117 {
00118     // instantiate a Peak
00119 
00120     Peak peak;
00121 
00122     peak.mz = 1;
00123     peak.intensity = 2;
00124     peak.area = 3;
00125     peak.error = 4;
00126     peak.frequency = 5;
00127     peak.phase = 6;
00128     peak.decay = 7;
00129 
00130     if (os_) *os_ << peak << endl;
00131 
00132     // write out XML to a stream
00133 
00134     ostringstream oss;
00135     XMLWriter writer(oss);
00136 
00137     peak.write(writer);
00138     if (os_) *os_ << oss.str() << endl;
00139     
00140     // allocate a new Peak
00141 
00142     Peak peakIn;
00143 
00144     if (os_) *os_ << peakIn << endl; 
00145     unit_assert(peak != peakIn);
00146 
00147     // read from stream into new Peak
00148 
00149     istringstream iss(oss.str());
00150     peakIn.read(iss);
00151 
00152     // verify that new Peak is the same as old Peak
00153 
00154     if (os_) 
00155     {
00156         *os_ << peakIn << endl; 
00157         XMLWriter osWriter(*os_);
00158         peakIn.write(osWriter);
00159     }
00160 
00161     unit_assert(peak == peakIn);
00162 }
00163 
00164 
00165 void test()
00166 {
00167     testPeak();
00168 }
00169 
00170 
00171 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00172 {
00173     try
00174     {
00175         if (argc>1 && !strcmp(argv[1],"-v")) os_ = &cout;
00176         if (os_) *os_ << "PeakDataTest\n";
00177         test(); 
00178         return 0;
00179     }
00180     catch (exception& e)
00181     {
00182         cerr << e.what() << endl;
00183     }
00184     catch (...)
00185     {
00186         cerr << "Caught unknown exception.\n";
00187     }
00188     
00189     return 1;
00190 }
